intro: Leptocoma racemosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has slender, branching stems. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces clusters of blue or purple flowers in the summer. It is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks.
